My reason is simple (I have been saying it for years) and that is I just don't care what their name is. I can remember who they are and their face, but unless they are someone important or work with (and even then I sometimes forget which is the worst part and why I'm here) I simply don't give a fk what their name is. My brain has waaaaay more important things to remember than an arbitrary name of someone. If they have a common name or one that I can relate to another person it will actually help. Common names and names that I like are easy to remember.

When someone new tells me their name, I allways repeat it out loud, then say "cool" or something similar and introduce myself with "Hi insert new name here I am -insert own name here." And if there is a small new group of people after I actively tried to memorize their names, I go at least once around the group repeating their names while pointing at them.
This has always been deemed "cute", "adorable" and other positive things, but never negative, because I put an effort into memorizing their names and that puts me in a very positive light making it easy for them to remember my name by what I did and what they felt because of it. And it makes asking for their names that much less uncomfortable since I already showed them I might have problems remembering their names (somebody who puts that much effort into memorizing my name must have problems with memorizing new names, so of course it is ok if he asks for my name again or mistakes it for another name in a few minutes)

I have the opposite problem: I remember too much information about people without even trying. If I only met you once and we exchanged a few details with each other, I will remember ALL of those details the next time I see you, whereas you may not even remember having MET me before. I've learned to 'play dumb' around people I don't know that well so that they don't think I'm some kind of creeper or stalker. Sometimes I'll pretend to forget their name for a second and then suddenly 'remember' it, or if they share a detail they already shared I'll just pretend like it's the first I'm hearing it. Having a great memory is very beneficial for school but can make socializing hard lol.

The last one kinda relate to a theory I had for a long time. Now I don't base this on anything I just kinda thought it up. I basically changed school/educational facility every year of my life, so at most I would stay in one school for like 2 years (I did once or twice). I did this through my childhood and early adulthood. So I got this theory that in the back of my mind I got used to not sticking around the same people for that long and so I would only remember the names of people I interacted nearly constantly with. It may sound a bit depressing to some but I'm quite alright, just wanted to tell the story to make it easier to understand my reasoning.
